author: wsjcom
title: What’s News: Business & Finance
text:
0 COMMENTS Comcast is offering $30.9 billion to acquire Sky, topping a rival bid from Fox to consolidate ownership of the U.K. broadcaster.
Powell voiced optimism about the economy, signaling the Fed is on track to keep lifting rates and may even pick up the pace.
The Dow tumbled 299.24 points to 25410.03 as Powell’s comments did little to cool inflation fears.
More firms are boosting their dividends, even as higher bond yields threaten the allure of stocks.
T. Boone Pickens’s ETF, which focuses on energy producers and users, is set to start trading Wednesday.
Some Japanese investors are selling U.S. Treasurys on fears Trump’s policies will weaken the dollar.
Fidelity posted record revenue and operating profit in 2017 as investment performance improved.
U.S. consumer confidence rose this month to its highest level since 2000.
Home prices rose in December, but there were signs that gains could ease.
Boeing and the Trump administration reached a deal to replace Air Force One.
Macy’s shares jumped after the retailer reported stronger holiday sales.
JPMorgan said it is optimistic about 2018 and the impact of the new tax law.
Kushner Cos. is in talks to buy the remaining stake in a Manhattan office tower.
